reportText: @ Canyon Mouth , 31 cfs @ Fort Collins , 3 cfs @ North Fork below Seaman Reservoir The gauge reading has shed it's ice and come down to a more normal flow rate. There is still plenty of ice in the canyon, however there are some holes still open. The weather looks great over the next week though, so get out there! Check out the town sections near Watson Lake and Lions Open Space, or head up under the dam in Estes to fish the Big T tailwater! Cold water temperatures will keep our bug diversity and size down. The afternoons have been seeing some rising action so don't discount the dry fly and emergers! Wherever you head in the Fort Collins area to fish, bugs will be small. Sz 20-24 Midge and Baetis patterns, and keep in mind emerger patterns of equivalent sizes. Try a UV Emerger or a Bling Midge! Dare we say keep an eye for the midge hatches and maybe some BWO's. Check out a Charlie Craven's Mole Fly, or Shucking Midge to fool those trout that are sipping! Keep and eye on the flows in Gateway, a bump above 10 always gets the fish happy here. In Town has flow currently, so this should be on your list now! If the inconsistent weather is too much for you, you can switch into tying mode and get creative! Check out our Intro to Fly Tying Class if tying is new to you! Check out our Poudre Assortment of bugs, nice Gateway assortment for the time! HERE! If you are looking for some help in this time to find fishable water or how to fish this technical stuff, come see us at either shop!
